courseInfo.prerequisite: Basic knowledge of computer networks, website and Internet, Basic mathematical concepts and modular arithmetic.

rationale: Understanding cryptography and web security is essential in today's digital landscape, where the protection of sensitive information is the main goal. It is the backbone of secure communication, financial transactions and data integrity across the internet. Incorporating cryptography fosters a culture of security awareness, essential for protecting information in our increasingly connected world. The subject Cryptography and Web Security aims to equip students with the foundational knowledge and practical skills required to understand and apply key security principles. The students will explore essential cryptographic algorithms: symmetric and asymmetric, and study their applications in real-world scenarios. The course also covers critical web security protocols including SSL, HTTPS, and firewall mechanisms, enabling students to understand vulnerabilities and secure online systems. Through Python-based programming implementations, students will gain hands-on experience in developing simple cryptographic solutions, thereby enhancing their analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills. This subject lays a strong foundation for advanced studies and careers in cyber security, ethical hacking, and secure software development.

courseOutcomes.description: Explain the concept of information security in network communication.
Use number theory to solve problems related to cryptographic computations.
Use web security principles and protocols to ensure secure communication.
Classify various types of firewalls based on their characteristics.

content: 1.1 Computer Security, Cyber Security, Information Security and Network Security
1.2 Essential network and computer security requirements
1.4 Security Attacks: Passive Attacks, Active Attacks
• 2.2.1 Modular arithmetic properties over addition, subtraction and multiplication operations
• 2.3.3 Calculation of addition - multiplication tables with its inverse
2.4 Calculation of GCD and Multiplicative inverse
• 2.4.2 Extended Euclidean algorithm for multiplicative inverse
• 3.2.1 Mono alphabetic ciphers: Additive, Multiplicative, Affine and Mono alphabetic substitution cipher
• 3.2.2 Poly alphabetic ciphers: Autokey, Vigenère, Playfair, Hill, One-time pad cipher
• 3.3.2 Keyed transposition method, keyed columnar transposition, its key inversion
• 3.4.2 Confidentiality in public-key cryptography, Authentication in public-key cryptography
• 3.4.3 Basic working of RSA algorithm and its key-generation
4.2 Secure Socket Layer and Transport Layer Security
4.4 Basic Concept of Secure Electronic Transactions
• 5.1.1 Intrusion and classification of intruders: Masquerador, Misfeasor, and Clandestine users
• 5.1.2 Intrusion detection system and approaches to intrusion detection: Misuse detection, Anomaly detection

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Prepare a study report on recent cyber-attacks in India and its impact.
Calculate Greatest Common Divisor using Euclidean algorithm. Display each step in tabular format.
Implement Extended Euclidean algorithm to check whether the multiplicative inverse exists or not in Zn. If exist calculate positive inverse.

Prepare a module for Additive cipher. Implement encryption and decryption algorithms in two separate user-defined functions in it. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, key and performs encryption-decryption.
Write a program to apply Brute-force attack on cipher text and find the key as well as plain text which is encrypted by Additive cipher.

Prepare a module for Multiplicative cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in the module. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, key and performs encryption-decryption using this module.

Prepare a module for Mon alphabetic substitution cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in it. Write an interactive program that inputs key (mapping of 26 characters to each other), plain text and performs encryption-decryption using this module.

Prepare a module for Autokey cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in it. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, key and performs encryption-decryption using this module.

Prepare a module for Vigenère cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in the module. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, key and performs encryption-decryption using this module.

Prepare a module for matrix multiplication. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, perform necessary calculation and then call matrix multiplication( ) to perform encryption and decryption using Hill cipher (3×3 matrix i.e. maximum plain text length = 9 characters). If less characters input then pad with character 'z'. Key matrix (K) is given with its inverse (K -1 ). One of the key pair K = [5 7 10 13 0 17 7 5 4 ] and K -1 = [21 14 1 0 13 8 25 3 8 ]

Prepare a module for keyless rectangular(columnar) cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in the module. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text and performs encryption-decryption using this module. No of columns = 4.

Prepare a module for keyed transposition cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in the module. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, permutation key and performs encryption-decryption using this module.

Prepare a module for keyed columnar transposition cipher. Define two separate functions for encryption and decryption algorithms in the module. Write an interactive program that inputs plain text, permutation key and performs encryption-decryption using this module.
